content: Is generating this particular instance so expensive (-0.2% to build time), or is it a fluctuation?

Taking the file with the largest reported speed-up, namely Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Field/Basic.lean, most of the declarations seem to take the same number of heartbeats on 4c17d273bea4e433941a7f7725da94dd653d170f (Yury's PR commit to master) and 25ffff65d07b0c88e418c1ecf26701808e521196 (the commit before). The positivity extension stuff at the bottom seems to be a bit quicker but it's difficult to see any difference. The only other declaration I found where there was a 10% speed up was LinearOrderedSemiField.toDenselyOrdered so I am a bit baffled by this.

The global linter.countHeartbeats linter would be helpful for this but it seems to be broken.
